title: Jamie Laing is 'too old' for Made In Chelsea claim Spencer and Vogue
text:
Made In Chelsea’s Spencer and Vogue say Jamie Laing is ‘too old’ for the show (Picture: Getty Images)

Spencer Matthews and Vogue Williams believe their Made In Chelsea buddy Jamie Laing is ‘too old’ for the show.

The duo, who tied the knot for the second time in September, spoke out about the reality star when appearing on The Independent‘s dating and relationships podcast Millennial Love.

And while claiming that the E4 hit is fueled by drama, the loved up pair seemed keen to try and get Jamie on their upcoming programme Spencer, Vogue and Wedding Two.

The proud wifey explained: ‘We don’t have makeups and break ups on our show,’ before her other half jumped in: ‘If you’re an adult that takes Made In Chelsea seriously, I suggest you take a look at yourself.’

Vogue added: ‘Jamie Laing is probably too old for that makeup and break up stuff.’

They want him to jump ship to their own reality show (Picture: Getty Images)

And it seems the former reality villain was in agreement, as he continued: ‘Yeah, Jamie Laing, being 31 in November, is too old for that show. I have spoken to him about it.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘We had a meeting with one of our producers today to see if he can jump ship onto our show were we to do a third one. He’d be better suited to it.’

The model affirmed: ‘It’s easier to be nice on our show as well.’

Jamie has appeared on the popular programme since the second season debuted back in 2011, and was supposed to be on this year’s Strictly Come Dancing.

Jamie recently had to quit Strictly after injuring his ankle (Picture: Rex)

However, after injuring his ankle, the actor has to drop out last minute, with Kelvin Fletcher stepping in as his replacement.

But it seems Jamie will be back on out screens in no time, as he was recently pictured filming out in Japan.

Earlier this month, he headed over to East Asia ahead of the Rugby World Cup alongside sporting legend Ugo Monye.

The pair were flown out to the nation by O2 as part of their Travel Fan series, which saw them engage and delight in various facets of Japanese culture ahead of the sporting event.

Posing for a picture with his pants by his ankles, the star told his followers: ‘Ugo insisted that we had to be naked when looking at the views in Japan – so we believed him.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Spencer, Vogue and Wedding Two, starts Monday, on E4, at 10pm

description: Jamie Laing is 'too old' for Made In Chelsea claim Spencer Matthews and Vogue Williams.
